solution_01_data_basics/02_proportion/08_read_circle_prop_v3

video

The first 4 questions involve adding up relative frequencies of the indicated intervals. The last 4 questions can be done by guessing and checking until something works.


  1. (0.45) The proportion of measurements less than 4.5 is 0.45. \[\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}<4.5]=0.45\]
  2. (0.3) The proportion of measurements more than 6.5 is 0.3. \[\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}>6.5]=0.3\]
  3. (0.2) The proportion of measurements closer than 1 units from 6.5 is 0.2. \[\text{prop}[|\mathbf{x}-6.5|<1]=0.2\]
  4. (0.95) The proportion of measurements farther than 0.5 units from 7 is 0.95. \[\text{prop}[|\mathbf{x}-7|>0.5]=0.95\]
  5. .(3.5) The proportion of measurements less than 3.5 is 0.35. \[\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}<3.5]=0.35\]
  6. .(4.5) The proportion of measurements more than 4.5 is 0.55. \[\text{prop}[\mathbf{x}>4.5]=0.55\]
  7. .(1) The proportion of measurements closer than 1 units from 2.5 is 0.2. \[\text{prop}[|\mathbf{x}-2.5|<1]=0.2\]
  8. .(1) The proportion of measurements farther than 1 units from 5.5 is 0.75. \[\text{prop}[|\mathbf{x}-5.5|>1]=0.75\]
